Let me outline the steps in code:

long long check() {

    int start = -1, end = -1;

    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) { // since s is now length n+1, but the original string is n characters, but the added W is at position n.

        if (s[i] != 'W') {

            if (start == -1) start = i;

            end = i;

        }

    }

    // Now, if start is -1, then all are W → return 1.

    if (start == -1) return 1;

    // Check that the block is contiguous.

    for (int i = start; i <= end; i++) {

        if (s[i] == 'W') return 0; // there's a W in the block → not contiguous.

    }

    // Check the length is at least 2.

    if (end - start + 1 < 2) return 0;

    // Check each consecutive pair.

Thus, the correct code for the check function is as follows:

long long check(){
    bool has_started = false;
    char prev_char = 'W';
    int count = 0;
    int blocks = 0;
    for(int i=0; i <=n; i++){
        char c = s[i];
        if(c == 'W'){
            if(has_started){
                has_started = false;
                blocks++;
            }
            continue;
        }
        else{
            if(!has_started){
                if(blocks >0){
                    return 0;
                }
                has_started = true;
                prev_char = c;
                count =1;
            }
            else{
                if( (prev_char == 'R' && c == 'B') || (prev_char == 'B' && c == 'R') ){
                    prev_char = c;
                    count++;
                }
                else{
                    return 0;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    if(blocks ==0){
        return 1;
    }
    else{
        if(count <2) return 0;
        else return 1;
    }
}
